meanings.sent1: I will buy a toy with my allowance.
meanings.sent2: She decided to buy a new dress for the party.
meanings.sent3: I tried to buy my way out of doing chores with candy.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed was so strong, it seemed like he could buy success itself.
meanings.sent5: The idea of buying happiness with money is a common misconception.

meanings.definition: Acquire possession of by paying for.
meanings.sent1: He will buy a ticket to the movie.
meanings.sent2: They bought a house in the suburbs.
meanings.sent3: I tried to buy a good night's sleep with a fancy pillow.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was so infectious, it felt like you could buy joy from her.
meanings.sent5: The old saying goes, you can't buy love, but you can buy a puppy.

meanings.sent1: I can buy a book at the bookstore.
meanings.sent2: They can buy groceries at the supermarket.
meanings.sent3: I tried to buy time by pretending to be busy.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was so strong, it felt like she could buy anything she wanted.
meanings.sent5: In a world where money is no object, you can buy anything your heart desires.
